segments.text: How are you finding your new boss ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: She's not bad . She's a bit bossy , but I'm sure I'll get used to her .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Would you rather have her or your old boss back ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: She's far better than my old boss . He didn't know how to express his opinion without putting at least one other person down .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: They are all pretty easy-going . It's a very friendly place to work .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Do you miss your old co-workers ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Of course . I spent so much time at my old workplace that I got to know them all very well . They were like family to me .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Do people in different departments get along with each other ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Sure . Since we work together in teams , we have to get along with each other .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Do you like working in teams with people from different departments ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , it helps everyone to understand what we're doing from different perspectives .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Do you like working in teams ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I prefer it to working independently . I think most people do .
segments.speaker: S2
